    Convert Nested Columns Between Data Frame and Data Table

    convert_nested.Rd

    This function converts a data frame or data table, transforming nested columns to either data frame or data table format while preserving the original data structure.

    convert_nested(data, to = c("df", "dt"), nested_cols = NULL)

    Arguments

    data

    A data frame or data table containing nested columns

    to

    A character string specifying the target format. Options are "df" (data frame) or "dt" (data table). Defaults to "df".

    nested_cols

    A character vector of column names containing nested data. If NULL, the function automatically detects list columns.

    Value

    A data frame or data table with nested columns converted to the specified format

    Details

    The function performs the following operations:

    • Automatically detects nested columns if not explicitly specified

    • Converts the entire data structure to the target format (data frame or data table)

    • Converts nested columns within the specified columns to the target format

    • Creates a copy of the input data to avoid modifying the original

    Note

    • The function preserves the original data structure

    • Nested columns are converted individually

    • Automatic detection of nested columns is based on list-type columns

    Examples

    # Convert a data frame with nested columns to data table
df_nest1 <- iris |> 
  dplyr::group_nest(Species)
df_nest2 <- iris |>
  dplyr::group_nest(Species) |>
  dplyr::mutate(data2 = purrr::map(data, dplyr::mutate, c=2))
# Convert a data table with specific nested columns to data frame
convert_nested(df_nest1, to = "dt", nested_cols = c("data"))
#>       Species               data
#>        <fctr>             <list>
#> 1:     setosa <data.table[50x4]>
#> 2: versicolor <data.table[50x4]>
#> 3:  virginica <data.table[50x4]>
convert_nested(df_nest2, to = "dt", nested_cols = c("data", "data2"))
#>       Species               data              data2
#>        <fctr>             <list>             <list>
#> 1:     setosa <data.table[50x4]> <data.table[50x5]>
#> 2: versicolor <data.table[50x4]> <data.table[50x5]>
#> 3:  virginica <data.table[50x4]> <data.table[50x5]>
# Convert a data table with nested columns to data frame
dt_nest <- mintyr::w2l_nest(data = iris, cols2l = 1:2, by = "Species")
convert_nested(dt_nest, to = "dt", nested_cols = c("data"))
#>            name    Species               data
#>          <fctr>     <fctr>             <list>
#> 1: Sepal.Length     setosa <data.table[50x3]>
#> 2: Sepal.Length versicolor <data.table[50x3]>
#> 3: Sepal.Length  virginica <data.table[50x3]>
#> 4:  Sepal.Width     setosa <data.table[50x3]>
#> 5:  Sepal.Width versicolor <data.table[50x3]>
#> 6:  Sepal.Width  virginica <data.table[50x3]>
